Reviews.Title: “Loved the design of the interior of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaley7
Reviews.Content: Great location, right in the centre of Barcelona which is so close to all the shopping districts and sight seeing bus and the bus to airport departs in every 10 to 15 minutes depending on which terminal. the room is very spacious and clean. Breakfast is decent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: gilgil84
Reviews.Content: We spent the 1st night at a different hotel next to this one and really didnt like it. the day after we moved. i liked the clean, minimal ,modern design of the lobby and rooms. Our room was big enough, very clean and looked pretty new. the bathroom was spacious and very clean. look, its not a luxary hotel, but its very lovely and pleasant! the breakfast was ok, not more then that. (we paid for one morning) enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: Tony C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Right in the Centre of Barcelona - you couldn't have a better location for Shopping or Site seeing. The rooms were Clean, large and airy. The staff were very helpful and we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Barrankas
Reviews.Content: Perfect located near Placa Catalunya. Good price. Clean, quiet, cozy. Absolutely no claims to service or somerhing else.

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: greenlady77
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel, like we said we would, and we were even more impressed this time. The room was spotless (the one we were given last year had walls needing a lick of paint). If this hotel had wi-fi all over the hotel it'd be the cherry on top of the cake but that's not top of my list so I'll still give it maximum rating (as it happened I actually accessed the hotel's internet in the bedroom for a day or two on my iPod, but then it stopped and I had to use it in the reception area after that). The hotel is modern, the staff is friendly and helpful, it's perfectly located for transport and sightseeing, big bedrooms and bathrooms, very comfortable beds, flat screen TV's, safe, desk...just excellent. The price was also excellent (around 80€ p/night this time...of course, the rates change during the year but having stayed at another 3* hotel during my first trip to Barcelona and having paid more or less the same, this one felt like a 4*). Yes, we'll go back again. We're in love with Barcelona and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: purplehouse59
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of a few reviews here on trip advisor and I was unsure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. This hotel had everything we needed. We came to Barcelona for a long weekend just to do some sightseeing, a bit of shopping and to eat some tapas... if that sounds like you then this hotel fits the bill. It's in a geat location, literally just a few minutes walk from the Place de Catalunya which is pretty much the centre of Barcelona, where the Aerobus runs to and from the airport every 5 minutes or so. It's also only minutes away from Las Rambla, Casa Mila and Casa Battlo. Just a few doors down is one of the best tapas restaurants in barcelona 'Ciudad Condal' (just check out its reviews) and a few blocks away from Palacio Del Flamenco. We walked almost everywhere except Parc Guell.We had breakfast included in our booking which was your typical continental breakfast, which was quite sufficient. The hotel reception staff were all very friendly and extremely helpful. It's a good little hotel, in a great location and good value for money. The only thing I would say is that the front facing rooms can be a bit noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “A good surprise”
Reviews.Author: israelaviv
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel eventually, were pleasantly surprised this is a new hotel with modern rooms and wooden floor, the room clean and tidy, it has Internet-only lines, and no wifi . The price compared to the quality of the hotel very reasonable we spent 3 nights, and very enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Others have said it was a good place to stay. They were right!!”
Reviews.Author: CaptainRonn
Reviews.Content: Based on the TA reviews and emails shared with previous travelers, we reserved a "Rambla" room at the Onix for three nights prior to our trans-atlantic cruise back to the States. We arrived at the hotel around 1030 hrs. Our room was not yet available; so we stored our luggage in a locked room and walked down to the Plaza Catalunya and and to the large department store, El Corte Inglis. We window shopped, bought a few snacks at the grocery store in the basement of El Corte Inglis and returned to the hotel around noon. Our room was ready and David, the front desk receptionist, checked us in. Let me say that, as a veteran traveler, I have faced receptionists that are wonderful and some that emerge from the bowels of Hades. David was one of the most courteous, professional and informative desk managers that I have ever had the opportunity to meet. He greeted me each morning as I emerged from the elevator to go down the block to get coffee for my wife and answered many questions that we had about touring the city. Now, on to the hotel and room, The hotel exterior and lobby are exactly as pictured on TA. The marble makes for a beautiful entry. Our room faced the Rambla and had a small balcony. I chose this location knowing that we may hear street noises late into the night. While this was true when we had the french doors open, it was very minimal when the doors were closed. We truly enjoyed the view of the street; so we have no complaints. The room was minimally decorated; but extremely functional and comfortable. It was spotlessly cleaned each day and was large enough for the two of us to move around easily. We found the computer on the first floor to be accessible most of the time we chose to use it; and if we had to wait, it was only for a short time. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel; so I cannot comment on it. One evening, I realized that I had misplaced my power adaptor for my camera. When I inquired at the front desk, the young lady offered the use of one that the hotel had. Each and every staff member I met was quite affable during our stay. From our first encounter with David when we arrived until he secured a taxi for the ride to the port, he was always smiling and pleasant. He is a real asset to the hotel staff. The architecture of the interior of the hotel, a towering open staircase and the abundance of marble and hardwoods do amplify voices and doors closing; but it was not annoying enough to comment on. Would I stay here again. Absolutely Yes! We plan to go back next fall and look forward to staying at the Onix Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: ShanMara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in October for 3 nights before a cruise. It was our first visit to Europe and we selected the Onix because of reviews and the fact that we could get a "Shhh" room. We like quiet rooms! We thought the price (110E/night) was in the ballpark of other similar hotels. The location of the hotel is excellent - it is convenient to the metro, very close to many restaurants, Starbucks, gelato, a little "market," and the Placa Catalunya is 2 blocks away - easily walkable. Our "Shhh" room faced the back of the hotel, and although the view was not attractive, the room was quiet. AC worked well, there was a safe, the bed was comfortable, the storage spacious, the bathroom very clean. The people at the front desk were helpful if needed. Breakfast was 8.5E/person and it was convenient and worked well for us. I would recommend the Onix Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “a great surprise”
Reviews.Author: Uruguayos
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the hotel. The room was very big and the bed very comfortable. The location is superb. You are in a safe location, and everything is near: the underground, the commercial zone and restaurants. There is no wi fi in the room, but you can ask for a cable and you can connect with no charge at all. The breakfast was good, according to my taste. Definitely I'll come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tricia6
Reviews.Content: Clean, basic hotel in a quiter area, but central to everything

Reviews.Title: “Stayed before and after a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: webeenthere
Reviews.Content: We don't travel to 5 star luxury facilities, our focus is looking for a clean, comfortable hotel in a safe, convienent location. So we went looking for a small hotel away from Las Ramblas for 5 days before and one day after a cruise and found this one. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Had a quiet room at the back, it was very clean and fairly well kept. Some maintenance would dress it up. Beds were very comfortable for us. Location was fantanstic, one of the best tapas bars just down the street, a Nostrums next door for convenience items and being close to Placa de Catalunya, an easy to walk to a lot of the sites. Bathroom and facilities very clean and roomy. Pool on the roof is very small but very refreshing. Breakfast was pretty good and has bacon and eggs which you won't get in too many Barcelona places, 8 euros each but it's the only place open at 7:00am, no lunch or diner, bar service on the pedestrian boulevard. Still better to hit the street for food and drink and choice as there is lots within a 5 minute walk. All in all very good value and a great place to stay. Internet and WiFi available free.

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmntlw
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean,with a safe and stocked mini bar(extra) in room which we used to keep our water cold.Wi Fi in lobby area which works.Breakfast is average,cereal,pastries sausage and eggs,toast, yogurts and fruit but limited seating so you may have to wait for a free table and only one member of staff serving.Roof terrace and pool is a nice bonus.My husband would have liked to have stayed in a hotel on la ramblas as other family members did stay at Husa Oriente Hotel but our hotel was better and cleaner in my opinion but added a further 10min walk from heart of la ramblas.I preferred to be in the quieter area and dont mind the walk but because our meeting point was always other hotel the distance was more noted.Hotel Onix is at the top end of La ramblas and main bus station is close by as is metro stations.Overall a nice stay in a fantastic city. Would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “MARAYAPAPAYA”
Reviews.Author: Maraya S
Reviews.Content: my husband and I and another couple spend 3 days at this wonderful hotel in barcelona , everyone was very helpful and cordial specially the director of hotel operations Isabel flores parodi she was very profesional and very nice we felt right at home we also liked "paco" the breakfast waiter what a sweet person he was , over all we had the best time , we will recommend this hotel to all of our friends .. so long for now .. we will see you may be next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: JaneyAdmira
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend during the Mercè festival. The hotel was clean and in a great location near Placa Catalunya. The staff were friendly and I always had good service at reception if I needed information or assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Mlinklater
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, well located with friendly and helpful staff. Will stay there again on my next trip to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start for a few-day-trip !”
Reviews.Author: valkirius
Reviews.Content: Pefrecty located on La Rambla Catalunya. Close to 2 key metro stations. Short walk to main city alley. Lovely restaurants with tapas and sangria just in a frotn of hotel. Food much better than on the main route to Port. Clean, comfortable, causy. I recommend rooms with a look at the street for those who want to feel the night city rythm. Not for those who need to sleep in total silence. Quite a good breakfast with offer for those on diet. A breakfast waiter is not so fast so sometimes you have to wat untill the whole assortment is refilled. Nice small pool on a roof ;) It was funny experience to swim in the mid of September at the top of Barcelona. The WiFi is accesable only in a lounge.

Reviews.Title: “5* City; 4* Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ben11v11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onix Rambla Hotel for six nights earlier this month and rather liked it. First impressions weren’t great, as we were greeted rather sullenly by the receptionist, who informed us that we’d arrived fifteen minutes too early to check in. However, when the rooms were ready we found them to be modern, spacious and spotlessly clean. We had booked into two rooms – one at the front of the hotel (Room 504) that overlooked Rambla de Cayalunya and one to the rear of the building (Room 505) with a window that overlooked the central atrium. Both were on the fifth floor. We asked for one quiet room and hence were given the one to the rear. I stayed in the room to the front of the hotel and really enjoyed watching the world go by from the french windows. Although the rooms to the rear of the hotel are sold as being the quiet ones, we found that with being on the fifth floor, even the rooms at the front of the hotel were quiet enough and we were never disturbed in the night. On the whole we found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was very similar to most continental hotels, with plenty to choose from, although no rotation in what was served. This hotel has to be in one of the best locations in Barcelona. It was a two/three minute walk from the Aerobus (airport shuttle bus) stop, and barely any distance from the Ramblas. If you’re in Barca for a few days or more we’d recommend buying a two day ticket for the open top buses that travel around the city between the main tourist attractions. These are cheaper than hiring a taxi and much safer than using the Metro (beware of pickpockets). The definite highlight of this hotel was the rooftop swimming pool. Although only fairly small, it was great for cooling off in at the end of the day. The only inconvenience that we came across with this hotel was that there was no safe in one of the rooms. Apparently it was broken and away being fixed, but we stayed for nearly a week and it was never returned. As our party was in two rooms, we were able to put all of our passports and money in one safe, but anyone booking into only the one room would have been stumped. We really enjoyed Barcelona, and the Onix Rambla is a great hotel to explore it from.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: 1331traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the centre so easy reachable by train or aerobus. We took a taxi which is about €25 for a single trip. Very friendly and professional service. Very much appreciated cabled internet. Breakfast was a bit less but there are excellent restaurants nearby. Located in the heart of the city: Rambla, shopping malls, sub- & railway, tourist lines, info points are all a 5 mins walk. Port Vell and beach 30 mins. You can get anywhere (cheap if you use subway) in a very short timeframe, avoid the tourist bus and get a free map. Clean rooms, wide bathroom. Non expensive minibar and refreshing pool on the roof. Will certainly revisit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “want to stay in this hotel for weeks!”
Reviews.Author: angellashes
Reviews.Content: wow. first off i just want to say this is my second time going to barcelona and i thought my first hotel was great till i stayed here. we stayed here at the end of our 2 week trip around spain and it was marvelous. what we paid and what we got really floored us. from when we first got onto the floor our room was on we realized that there were only 2 rooms on our side of the hotel floor and a huge reception area with a computer a free internet. they totally couldve made that area into another hotel room because the space was massive! then came our hotel room, which was much larger than expected. the bathroom was large and plenty of counterspace so 2 girls could store all of their toletries and still have space :) everytime we left our hotel room we felt like we were entering our own living room, i loved it! the best part was def the balcony facing las ramblas. it was a good feeling to wake up every morning and greet that famous busy street-- lucky for us though the hotel is not where all the crazieness of las ramblas is. other pluses were that the front desk is super friendly and had everything we asked for from wine openers to umbrellas. the location could not have been anymore perfect. right by a metro stop and walking distance to awesome restaurants and of coursing the best shopping! you are in the middle of the action minus all the crazy noise. we walked everywhere, and if you take a 15 minute walk down las ramblas you hit the waterfront which is beautiful at night. barcelona is really a magical city that makes my heart flutter just thinking about it. the food, the wine, the shopping, the nightlife-- everything is just above par here. and if you want to experience it all you will def stay here. this modern hotel goes above and beyond and i am itching to make a 3rd trip to barca to stay here and live out all my memories once more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , good hotel. Would return if ever...”
Reviews.Author: Lyteroptes
Reviews.Content: Very close to two Metro stations that will get you quickly onto all lines. Many eating places around - try Nostrum a few doors to really economise and the wonderful Obama is just around the corner. It's in easy walking distance of two of the Gaudi apartment buildings too. The hotel was very clean - rooms x01 to x04 face the front (Ramblas), x06-x09 face the rear and overlook the seemingly unused terrace. The rear is quieter with the constant hum of air con the only noise. All of these have tiny balconies. Beware of the x05 rooms - these have no external window, just one that opens onto the stairwell. We were given one of these initially but were swapped on request after the first night without any objections. Air con was very effective. There are no comfortable chairs in the rooms nor tea/coffee making facilities, nor does the hotel have room service. Reception staff were very helpful and friendly - we booked the Camp Nou trip through them. The hotel does have a bar - it's outside on Las Ramblas so its amongst many others. You can happily sit there and watch the men's men in their short shorts looking for the looks. Swimming pool is probably an exaggeration - it's about 3 teenage daughters long by 2 teenage sons wide but very refreshing on a hot day. There is little shelter from the sun on the roof and some days a lot of competition for the the space up there. Not sure if it was good value - it was just over 800 Euros for 2 rooms for 4 nights and that included the perfectly adequate breakfast (not that we had it on the last morning with a 6am start to get to Girona). Still we liked it so much we'd go again - the only other location we'd consider was somewhere close to the Picasso (and other) museums.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: zsofi_50
Reviews.Content: It is a lovely hotel in the middle of the city, we could reach fast everything on foot, the Plaza Catalunya is very close to the hotel, with all the bus and metro stations. You can get to the airport from there, every 15 minutes departs the bus. Or you can choose the train, which stops at the Passeig de Gracia Station. From there it is a 3-4 minutes walk. Our room was not noisy, because it was not facing the street. It was clean, the staff was helpful and polite, the service excellent.The room was clean, the FREE internet is great. The buffet breakfast was not in the price, but it was excellent. There are a lot of small restaurants just in front of the hotel and along the street. Don't miss to visit the Cerveceria Catalunya (Carrer de Mallorca 236, not far from the hotel), you'll find really good tapases there.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, and Value”
Reviews.Author: snapcam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights prior to joining a cruise. The airport bus left us at Catalunya and it was a short 2 block walk to the hotel. The location is GREAT. on La Ramba Catalunya. Five minutes and you are on La Rambla itself. The Onix Rambla was a real surprise with its very modern design. The stairway is almost Hogworts. The room was clean and pleasently presented although showing some signs of needing freshened up. A very minor quibble. The staff when we encountered them were pleasant and helpful. Really you only met the receptionist and the breakfast server. Breakfast was as you expect on the continent i.e. continental, with an attempt at scrambled egg and sausage for the Brits. There is also a very nice little sun garden and small swimming pool on the roof. Really nice place for some private sunbathing or just to relax away from the crowds. Our room was facing the street with a little balcony (lovely) looking out over the street cafes below. Usually quite, but on our first night Flamenco when on until around 03.00am. A little noisy but hey, we're in Spain! By the way the little cafe nx door does a lovely capacino for €2. When nx in Barcelona I would certainly return to the Onix Rambla

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: keix2
Reviews.Content: Sleek and clean. Stayed here for 4 nights and had a wonderful time in Barcelona. The location of the hotel is so good that you could walk anywhere down to La Rambla. Good place to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dlanor82
Reviews.Content: We stayed on floor 2 facing the rambla de catalunya. The room was quite although in the reviews many say that it is noisy at night. If you close the balcony door you meerely here anything. Our stay was very nice and the room was as described. The room was clean and spacious, although the double bed was in fact two single beds moved together. The A/C worked perfectly, breakast was superb, and receptionist where all very helpfull, expect one which in my opinion needs to learn how to be cortious with guests that ask him a question! Recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean and no disturbances.”
Reviews.Author: M_Ekdahl
Reviews.Content: No traffic sound in room. Big and clean. Reception very helpful. Nice pool on the roof. We will use this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: TTK
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I have stayed at in Barcelona this has been the best location - 2 minutes from the Passieg de Gracia and Placa Catalunya, plus more or next door to a great bar called Cuitat Condal. There is also a great take-away / eat in place called Nostrum more or less next door. We had a room at the back (had requested a quiter room) and were pleasantly surprised at the size, how airey it was and the big bathroom. Whilst the room could have done with a lick of paint it was very comfortable and we had a king size bed. It was really lovely to have a room with old fashioned doors and shutters and a balcony. The only downside of a room at the back was we could hear the air con from the hotel next door but guess that was quieter than the street side. It was also nice to stay in a fairly smallish hotel and we found the reception staff to be really helpful. The hotel has a lovely roof top area with sunbeds and a small pool. There is also a very small gym. We had breakfast included as part of our package - it was a cold buffet with some hot eggs and tortialla and sausages. Whilst the breakfast was fine (would have got bored with it if we had stayed more than 4 nights as same every day) the member of staff who served teas/coffees was rather sourely and we felt guilty asking for more drinks - although we got over that! On the same floor as the breakfast room there is free internet access which hardly seemed to be used. We had a great time in this hotel and would go back even if it was a bit more basic than some of the other hotels we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Frank&Norah
Reviews.Content: Great location: near the action and still quiet. Great walking in the vacinity, great eateris, shops, transportation Very friendly, helpful, non-intrusive staff. Small rooftop pool and sunning area Reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth time, and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: hobsonga
Reviews.Content: We always use this place as a base when we visit Barcelona,Why? Because the hotel is immaculate presented and wondefully situated in the city. Rooms are basic with good comfy beds, large bathroomand mimi bar. Breakfast is served on the 1st floor and is adequate, continental style with a few hot offerings of eggs etc. Priced at €8.50 its reasonable but you may choose to visit the numerous cafes, bars etc that serve breakfast close by. Check in and out of the hotel wasw very pleasant and easy and there is a taxi rank just 20 meters from the hotel. Taxi fare from the airport was €27.00 and takes 25 minutes..

Reviews.Title: “Room 101”
Reviews.Author: Belinda89
Reviews.Content: On a positive note, the rooms were spacious and the location good. I booked a Rambla room direct with the hotel and expected some street noise but not the heavy clumping from upstairs which made the metal grid of our air conditioning unit resonate. We should have asked for a room change at this stage. The room is next to a service lift and on the same floor as the kitchen so we were woken in the mornings and one night by a clattering trolley. We had breakfast at about 8.30each morning. We had to clear a table the first morning as no staff were visible and found 3 pastries left. The next morning there were no pastries and only 2 slices of local bread. Nothing was replenished and the "hot food" was always stone cold. One man on reception was helpful when we were locked out of our room because the woman who booked us in entered the wrong date for our final day. Otherwise, we found the service abupt and unfriendly. No one ever greeted us or returned a smile. I've found many excellent hotels through using Trip Advisor and always been too lazy to review them. I will definitely make an effort in future as I don't want this to be my only review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: Flannery52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights post-cruise, and I booked it because of 3 things: its great location (which other reviews mention, so I won't belabor that), its "Shhh" rooms which front an interior courtyard and not the busy street, and all the great TA reviews. Hotel Onix did not disappoint. The staff was most helpful. Initially, we were given a room fronting the street, but when I pointed out that I had reserved (and paid for) a "Shhh" room, we were quickly moved. All staff speak excellent English, and the map they give is excellent, as are the hints they offer. The hotel is spotlessly clean and minimalist. Not a lot of decoration, but the wood, chrome, and glass are quite pleasing in a Scandinavian type of way. Our room and bathroom were very large, and the bathroom amenities were sufficient, although I would have liked some lotion. We did not opt for the breakfast (an additional E8), but with so many cafes close by, we did not suffer!! And the Boqueria market is close enough to get a fruit-filled breakfast! The hotel has a large sitting room with one laptop and printer. People were frequently waiting to use it, but we found everyone to be considerate at keeping their time short. We paid $274 for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Enjoytravel75
Reviews.Content: We really loved our stay at the hotel. The location was perfect to walk to all the major sites. It's on Ramblas but not in the busiest section. It's also very close to the subway and train stops. The rooms are basic but provided what we needed. The breakfast was nice and the hotel staff was terrific. They provided maps and answered all our questions. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mymlanSweden
Reviews.Content: Pros: located just a block away from Placa Catalunya, thus very handy for both sights and shopping; metro very close. Bathroom large and clean. Cons: noicy at night if you have a room with window/balcony towards the street.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: bubskj
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were lucky to find this hotel cheap on travelzoo, £46 per night, which included breakfast, so we decided to give it a go. This was our first trip to Barcelona, so we wanted a hotel that was close to the city centre, with everything easily accessible. We got the train from BCN airport to "passage de gracia", and from here it was only a 5 minute walk to the hotel. It took 10 minutes the first time as we were unsure of its location, but apart from that, there were no real issues. Once we got to the hotel, the guy behind the desk was very polite and helpful and even allowed us to check in nearly 2 hours early. He even offered to print off the bus timetable to Girona (our return flights were from Girona airport as it was half the price). The only complaint I would have at this point was the fact that once we got to our room , we noticed that it was 2 single beds pushed together. We went downstairs to explain that we had asked for a double room, and he told us that there were none left. That was fine. The problem was the fact that he didn't have the courtesy to tell us beforehand. Anyway.... The hotel itself was very clean and tidy. The lobby had a small seating area, where you could sit and use the hotel's free wi-fi(only on ground floor). The room was big and had evrything you expect a room to have; bedside table, wardrobe, tv, desk, etc. The bathroom was lovely with plenty of space and had soap, towels, and shampoo which was good. Our room was facing out on to the main sreet, and noise levels were actually lower than we had expected(Thursday night and Friday night). The top floor was home to a (smallish) outdoor pool and sunbeds, but the weather was slightly on the breezy side for us to make use of these. It was a typical European breakfast ( croissants, fruit, yoghurt, cheese, ham, etc.) and this was more than enough to get you started for the day. If breakfast is not included, then I would maybe suggest eating elsewhere so that you have a bit more variety. When you walk in to the breakfast room, the lady asks you if you would like tea or coffee, which is nice. However, the reaction you get when you ask for another one is not so nice, to say the least. She did comply, but slightly unwillingly, or so it seemed. Location-wise, you'll be hard pressed to find a place situated more central to all the sights in the centre. Las Ramblas is a 5 minute walk away, and the marina is maybe 15/20 minutes away, but you walk straight down Las Ramblas so do not realise as you'll be taking in the surroundings. Gothic area is around 10/15 minutes away, and for everything else you can just use the simple metro system. I would definately reccommend this this hotel for first timers' in BCN, as evrything you will need is within close proximity. Look around for special deals! I went to Barcelona with a girlfriend, and came back with a fiance, so when I inevitably go back, I will consider staying at the Onix Rambla again, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: nthomson
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 day stay at Onix Rambla. 1st visit to Barcelona and it's always a gamble where to stay, but this gamble paid off! Hotel was in a prefect location for us, right beside the metro, and within walking distance of Las Ramblas, Placa de Catalunya. For city breaks I am happy to stay somewhere that is clean and in a good area and this ticked those boxes. We ended up at the Ciudad Condal restaurant just along from the hotel 3 nights out the 4 and we loved it! Obamas bar is worth a visit too, and then City Hall until the early hours! It was perfect for us!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Nieuwerkerk aan den Ijssel, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, spacious, simple yet elegant”
Reviews.Author: jota
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a couple of nights in this hotel through its own website. We found out there was a winter special with breakfast included. The hotel decor was minimalist and simple, yet elegant. We picked a room in the back to avoid all the noise from the traffic up front. We were glad we did; we didn't have any problems sleeping through the night. The bathroom was very clean and shower run properly. Breakfast was served from 7:00am - 11:00am and it was actually pretty good to set you up for the day. We thought the greatest thing this hotel has to offer was the excellent location. Very close to several metro stations, restaurants, main attractions. The winter special price was a plus. sleeping rooms in the back are very quite. Rooms are spacious and the hotel is very clean and modern. The hotel is perfect for guest that do not expect frills and fancies. If you are not a demanding guest, do yourself a favor....stay at this hotel and enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: alexish75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Onix Rambla hotel for New Year's Eve. In addition to the great location, the room was very comfortable and clean. Furthermore, service was highly appreciated by their professionalism and friendlyness. I have no hesitiation in recommending Onix Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Japandude
Reviews.Content: Pros: ________ + Very clean rooms + Beautiful view (from the veranda/porch) down the street and looking up towards the hills + Very helpful hotel staff and at least bilingual (Spanish / English) probably speak Catalan also. Helped recommend good places to buy shoes and flamenco shows. +/- Nice breakfast (our was included free), but if you have to pay 9EUR, it might be better looking elsewhere if you more value for 9euros. +/- Good location, not on the Ramblas, but close. About a 5-10 minute walk from a metro station. + Cons: ________ - First night sleeping here, my wife woke up at 3:30am to a woman and a group of guys fighting and yelling, also what sounded like a taser/tazer gun. Lasted for almost 2 hours and it was difficult to sleep. In the city I imagine this happens a bit, and it only happened the first night, but it was disturbing none the less. - Be mindful of the EXACT name and EXACT street name of the Onix Rambla hotel, as there are similar names and similar streets (Placa de Catalunya cf. Rambla de Catalunya). Lead to difficulties in finding the hotel the first time and from a taxi driver as well as a tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent central location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: roger1947
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few minutes easy walk from the central square Placa Catalunya end on to Las Ramblas but on a pleasant, broad, pedestrianised and relatively quiet road. Most rooms are large and comfortable, not richly furnished but very clean with a nice bathroom and balcony over the street (the balcony that is not the bathroom). We were spoilt for choice of cafes, bars, restaurants and bakeries all within a couple of hundred yards. The port is about 20 minutes walk down Las Ramblas or one of the other parallel streets, the cathedral is about the same distance and Gaudi's Sangria Familia is about 2 kilometres or around 30 minutes easy walking, past some great buildings and interesting shops. There are museums all around the area. There is internet connection but no wireless. There is a small rooftop pool and a pleasant sunbathing terrace. Most staff spoke English and were very pleasant and health. There was a secure room in which to keep luggage prior to flights on the final day. Breakfast at 8.6 euros was good value with variety, good quality and unlimited quantity. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lachee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Onix Rambla for three nights, the hotel is in a fantastic location. We had requested one of the Ssh rooms which is in the inner courtyard in the hotel, - quiet and relaxing. The room was a decent size with a large bathroom, all clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. We would stay here again - for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Disneyisme
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night prior to a cruise, but absolutely loved it. Rooms and bathroom were larger than I expected. Very modern facilites. We had a room with a balcony overlooking Ramblas. Not much noise....did hear a man yelling during the night but it didnt keep me up. Hotel has elevators so getting luggage to room was easy. Rooms do have AC. It was a very easy walk to the Hard Rock Cafe where we met friends. Very good location. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: iluvdemskittles
Reviews.Content: Recently returned after staying 3 nites at the Onix Rambla. The hotel stay was great, location was convenient and would recommend anyone traveling to Barcleona to stay at this hotel. Breakfast was included in the price, and it was more than enough to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob036
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights after a cruise. The front desk was always helpful and most spoke english. The room was large, modern and clean. They offered a breakfast buffet for 8 Euros per person and we thought it was well worth the cost. The only slight negative about this hotel is that it is 2 blocks from the Plaza Catalunya, but an easy walk!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Bezerra_RJ
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in Barcelona. Well located, very clean and calm. The receptionists were very helpful. The room is big and there is a mini bar on it. The shower is also very good. It is more expensive than others in the same region but it is worth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location for the sights of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: geonic
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel. It is centrally located to Placa de Catalunya, Las Ramblas and Gaudi sites. We had a room over the courtyard which we had requested and it was very quiet. Staff were very good and helpful and spoke English well. The rooms big and well appointed. Plenty of eating places nearby. Breakfasts were very good with an excellent variety of food. Excellent value at 8 euro per head.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: rdgeag
Reviews.Content: Located at the top of Las Ramblas, the rooms were clean and the service was great. An excellent value... we spent a total of two nights...one prior to our cruise and the night we returned..

Reviews.Title: “Two Stars”
Reviews.Author: Suedey
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hotel is perfect if you're considering shopping, sightseeing, clubbing or basing yourself in a Cultural Hot Spot. The Staff are friendly and professional and allowed us to leave our suitcases there much earlier than check in. There are large sofas in the Hotel Foyer but unfortunately there was no wireless which was advertised. Considering this was one of my 'conditions of satisfaction' it lost a Star in my estimation. WIFI is available outside in their street cafe between 4pm and midnight. I had to buy a €3.50 Carajillo (don't order one,it was lukewarm and bitter) to use the service. There is also free use of a PC on the first floor but it was not working. Apart from the negatives, the room was spacious, really clean and had a great view of Rambla Catalunya. Not many of the original building features remain apart from the windows (double glazed) but they have done a great refurb job making it a modern-ish hotel. I didn't try the breakfast so can't offer an opinion but the room and service looked very nice. There is a small swimming pool on the roof terrace with sun loungers, a perfect spot to cool off (or sunbathe) after walking around the city We payed €140 for one night in a twin room in June which wasn't great value considering we stayed at an excellent Four Star the following night for €89.

Reviews.Title: “THE PERFECT BARCELONA HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: partymaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona (post Cruise) and were absolutely thrilled with the Onix Rambla. The location of the hotel was perfect...on a quiet street not far from Las Ramblas. Hotel desk staff was courteous and helpful. Lots of nice restaurants nearby. Ciudad Condal (a great Tapas restaurant) in just a few doors away. The beds are quite comfortable and no problem getting extra pillows. Excellent value for the money in a prime location. Will DEFINITELY stay again when we visit Barcelona. On our last night we went to CARMEN'S TABLE, a flamenco show with dinner. We went with 20 new friends we met on the ship....the hotel arranged the tickets....A WONDERFUL EVENING.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mari1984
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the center of the city and it is close to everything, yet it is not noisy. The room was large and we loved the small balcony it had. Moreover, the room was clean and the personnel very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: chrisshaw
Reviews.Content: The beds were hard, the shower head wouldn't stay up, the breakfast was average, the pool is a wading pool, and when I went up to room and turned on the lights they didn't work. I had to go back downstairs to find out you need to place a card (not necessarily the room key) into an outlet to turn on the lights. I know the location and just needed a place to stay for the night. This was the only hotel with rooms on 5/25.

Reviews.Title: “Optimal Location”
Reviews.Author: BearcatNC
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay overall. For our tastes, the hotel is situated in an ideal location ... just 5 minutes away from the top of Ramblas (prone to constant noise and activity well into the night), in the lower part of the Eixample district. The hotel met our expectations, which were largely set by the web site, especially the room photos which were an exact match ... nothing very elegant, but adequate and functional. The only slight negative was the overly sour personality of the man that services the breakfast room ... he made everyone feel unwelcome. Were it not for the breakfast included at a good price, it would be smarter to go to one of the local cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “not good view”
Reviews.Author: eirinik75
Reviews.Content: nice good location hotel but the room i got with a balcony had no view at all

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Onix Rambla”
Reviews.Author: bertnspike
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. The lobby is comfortable. The front desk staff is great. There are no stairs from the street all the way to the elevator. There is room for a mobility scooter in the lobby and the rooms, and either of the 2 elevators can hold it. The rooms are nice. For an especially quiet room, ask for one overlooking the courtyard. All rooms have balconies where you can smoke, if you must, too. Your key card also turns on the lights and heat or a/c. The beds are okay, but too close to the floor. There is a taxi stop at one end of the street and an EXCELLENT tapas bar for breakfast - Ciudad Contal or Ciutat Comtal - at the other end, toward Placa Catalunya. Breakfast at the hotel is an additional 12 Euro and it is standard European hotel breakfast fare. It's fine, but for less than 12 Euro and a great meal, Cuidad Condal rocks. Many, many great restaurants and shops are within walking distance, even to a man who usually uses a mobility scooter. At Placa Catalunya you can find easy access to any other place in Barcelona and you can find places to buy tickets for transportation. As I said, we were very happy with the Onix Rambla and felt that they offered excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: WelshEdwards
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean with good sized rooms and a decent breakfast. The main advantage of this hotel is it's location - it's close to everything! When sightseeing, walk, it's much better than catching the tube as you get to take in all the sights and everything is within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to main sights in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ReviewersIreland
Reviews.Content: Wandered into this hotel from the street and luckily was able to book a room for 3 nights – great value. The receptionist was very helpful. Rooms are modern and clean. Very quiet at night despite being in a city centre location. There are lots of nice restaurants in the street outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware : thiefs operating within the hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarataNatiam
Reviews.Content: On my departure day, as I was paying my bill at the reception counter and while, apparently, there was only me and the cashier in the reception hall, I had my trolley stollen with all my documents, computers etc. The trolley was at my feet, between the counter and me. This hotel does not provide the security required to avoid this kind of well prepared theft: no guard, only one person at the reception when I was paying (morning 10 AM), no double door at the entrance, large dead angles helpful for thieves to hide and strike.

Reviews.Title: “most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: EnglandPanky
Reviews.Content: first class position right in the heart of the action but away from traffic and crowds. good value for money with spotless room including balcony overlooking tree, cafe lined street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JMPWales
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel in perfect location only a few minutes from Placa Catalunya. The rooms are quite large and bathrooms excellent. The breakfast area was roomy and the food was above average. Nice rooftop terrace with plunge pool and also terrace next to breakfast room open in summer. Hotel advertises the fact that it has air conditioning.. The four days we were there at the end of October were warm. I went to reception to ask whether the airconditoning was working and was informed that it was switched off for the winter. I asked if it could be switched on due to it being unduly warm for the time of year and the reply was no and if I was too warm open the window Had to keep the window open every night and the noise from street below kept me awake. The desk staff that we encountered were surly and unhelpful . I have sent emails to the management complaing about the service and the fact that air conditioning was off and to date have not had a reply I would recommend the hotel to friends because it is such good value ( 85euros b&b) but would tell them abut the problems I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: kbecker480
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, basic hotel. Location was pretty good - metro stop about a block away, airport train stop is about 5 blocks away. Plenty of restaurants and shopping in the area. There's a public computer with Internet access, which was nice... no free wi-fi. Breakfast was typical European fare, you will have to ask a server for coffee. It's on an active street, but the double glazed windows are amazing at keeping the noise down.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Carryon619
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a three to four star place to stay in Barcelona stop looking. This is the best value for the money, great location and excellent staff. Located right on the Rambla de Catalunya just a block from the center of the city (Placa de Catalunya) within easy walking to all the sites and old parts of the city. It is also on the metro system. Our breakfast was included and was very good. In comparison to the hotels in Paris and other cities in France the Onix Rambla is far better value. The room was very large, well equipped and very clean. The bathroom was perfect. We would definitely go back everything about this hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Riff M
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4night stay with my sister. The hotel is located on a great street with a pedestrian walk,shops and restaurants. It is about 1 1/2 blocks from Placa Catalunya where the Aerobus leaves you and where the hop on hop off tour buses begin. It is smallish(40rooms) and NON smoking. Our room had french doors and a small balcony facing the street. Inside was quiet although the hotel was quite booked, we heard no other guests in their rooms. The room had its own safe,minibar(with reasonable prices) and a large bathroom. We had 2 very comfy beds with large pillows. We got extra towels without asking for them. The breakfast buffet was quite ample with everything from eggs/bacon to pastries, yoghurt, fruit,cereal etc. They even had a little table with "diet food". There was also one free computer to use. The staff was quite willing to answer questions and make restaurant reservations even before we arrived. You need only to ask for whatever help you need. We booked early and got a nice rate. We were sorry we were too busy to use the sun deck and small pool. This area is full of much more expensive hotels so if you want to stay there but don't want to break the bank then this is the place for you!!

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: lemayo
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Very close to Ciudad Condal, a tapas restaurant ideal to visit at breakfast time or any time of the day really. Nice room, very nice bathroom. Good little roof terrace with tiny pool but you can do laps in it! Much better than nothing at all. You can get towels from the little fitness room also on the top floor. Best thing of all - good price! However, we asked for a double bed but got the almost ubiquitous twin beds. We stayed here for 1 night before our Catalunya walking holiday and Hotel Jazz afterwards. We slightly prefer Hotel Jazz, which has bigger pool, is more stylish, and has excellent soundproofing. It is quite a bit more expensive, however. Would return to Onix Rambla if price were an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Tezgeo
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 2 night stay at this hotel and it was great, The hotel itself is a nice modern clean hotel in a great location. The room was large, clean modern with a large bed, TV with an english speaking news channel, Mini Bar and safe, We had a balcony that overlooked the street and the bathroom was also spacious and clean with bath and shower. Breakfast was also good with a large selection of hot and cold foods and the staff were very helpfull on reception! I would definatley recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jackiesouthwales
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very difficult to find in the car (yes, I know now - don't EVER take a car into Barcelona!) and its location, though central to the major attractions such as Sagrada Familia, La Pedrera, Parc Guell, etc, was a bit of a hike from the old town and beaches. All previous reviewers' plus points are correct: modern, spacious - I liked its minimalism - and the tiny pool is nice to cool off in. But I felt it was actually quiet expensive for what you get. Stay at the Banys Oriental in the Barri Gotic instead. It's smaller, but better value for money and directly outside the Jaume 1 tube station, which will get you anywhere you need to go. Barcelona, though - what a city! LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Periscope
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in a gruop of friends and wifes before taking on a bisycle tour in Catalonia. Thre wonderful days, not least thanks to the hotel. Location is middle of everything, La Rambla, Plaza Catalonia, shopping, Gaudi buildings, sight-seeing buses and a lot of nice restaurants. My friends used the roof-top pool and was very satisfied. Rooms were clean, nice bathroom with lot of space for all the ladies make-up-things. Friendly staff and a good (sufficient) breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “In one word: Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lennybruce
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an excellent location, a very large room, a clean modern interior and want great value for money then this is an excellent place to consider. Instead of carpeting that will look worn out in all but the finest and most expensive hotels the Onix Rambla has solved that problem with nice parquet floors throughout. It's located two blocks from the Place de Catalunya; one block from the great shopping street Passeig de Garcia, three blocks from the Ramblas; two great tapas restaurants are right out the front door. We had room 401, facing the Rambla de Catalunya, with a small french balcony and a view of Tibidabo. Internet access is free and the hotel provides the needed ethernet cable as it is not wifi. The hotel's el-fresco cafe does have free wifi so you can also use your laptop there while enjoying a drink or snack. Contrary to a previous comment our aircon worked perfectly. The only minus I can think of is that the hotel is still sorting out a solution to provide foreign language TV channels. Oh, if you are into room service, they don't have that. And the rooftop pool is quite small so don't expect to do laps. But to take a dip on a hot afternoon or warm evening and hang out on the roof it is more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern clean hotel, but lousy air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: rayzel
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the early morning after leaving a cruise ship. We were pleasantly surprised that the location was incredibly convenient, right down the street from Plaza de Catalunya and a block from the Ramblas. Even better, they had a room available at 10AM so we did not have to check our luggage and return later to get our room. The day was quite hot - over 90 degrees farenheit and we noticed that the lobby was rather warm. The desk clerk told us that they were having problems with the lobby A/C. When we went up to our room, we found it to be quite warm as well. We turned the A/C up to maximum fan and lowest temperature and went out. We told the clerk and he said they were waiting for a technician. Our A/C worked very very poorly for the three days of our stay. One clerk even gave us a room key to put in the energy-saver slot so we could keep the AC on all day, but even that did not help. They kept telling us that they were waiting for a technician. Finally, on our last morning, they offered us a new room, but my husband did not want to bother repacking all of our luggage for one night. On the good side, this hotel was very clean and the room was quite spacious. The bathroom was marble and there was lots of space in there as well. Our package included breakfast which was served in a pleasant, sunny room. It was quite plentiful including both hot and cold dishes and certainly more than adequate to keep us going until a late lunch. However, if breakfast is not included in your room, I would not spend more than 5 or 6E pp because you can go down the street on the Ramblas to the marketplace and get a really great breakfast for very little money. The hotel also offered free Internet access in a computer in the lounge which was a great ammenity. When we checked out, we asked for consideration on our bill due to the fact that our room was hot during this extremely hot weather spell. We were told that because we had a great price which included breakfast, they could not reduce our bill any further. I asked for the email for the management of the Onix chain and the desk clerk gave me that. Upon arriving home, I found an email from her correcting the information she had given me which was quite nice of her. Bottom line, I emailed them and never heard anything back at all. That drops their customer service rating way down even though the people at the desk were reasonably pleasant. I would recommend this hotel as great value and location, but not during the hot weather season.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable price for the good location”
Reviews.Author: bdo_2009
Reviews.Content: 1. the location was great and very near the catalunya square 2. clean and no undecent smell 3. the hotel staff could not speak very good english, not easy to communicate 4. i booked the room w/ balcony but they gave me the one without. so i told them to change as the price is different. it took me some time to make them understand what i was talking about. 5. breakfast was great with reasonable choice. but no butter for your bread! 6. there's no wireless internet access inside the room. you need to go to the reception to get a cable, which is free 7. no dental equipment but you could actually request them. i brought my toothbrush but i didnt have toothpaste. after long time of explanations, i realised that it is called dental cream, not toothpaste!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: AgnesHongKong
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite hard to find from the Metro station. Room is small. No toiletries whatsoever. The second day we were here, no hot water in the morning and NO water at all in the whole afternoon! The so-called swimming pool is smaller than a kiddie's pool. And the hotel rate is not cheap at all!! Bad choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location - amazing value too!”
Reviews.Author: Bunty5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best we stayed in during a month in Spain. Location is perfect - very convenient to everything but also nice and quiet. Rooms were spacious and immaculately clean, the bathroom was spotless, and the breakfast was terrific. There's even a small pool on the rooftop terrace - great for relaxing after a day of wandering around this beautiful city. Staff were very helpful with good English (much better than my Spanish!). I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant central location and a perfect haven from the bustle of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: lifebeginsatfifty
Reviews.Content: This fairly reasonably priced hotel is a great location for your trip to Barcelona. Just a minute from La Rambla, the busy central tourist area. Stepping into the air conditioned modern marble and wood reception area it is suddenly very quiet and peaceful. Staff are extremely helpful and efficient. We were offered a room facing the street, or the quiet rear of the hotel. We chose the latter. Both bedroom and bathroom were large and spotless. The roof offers a modern plunge pool and sun bathing area. There were also fitness bikes and shower facilities. The breakfast was buffet style and offered sufficient variety to satisfy most people. If you choose this hotel you will be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Shuuz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Onix Rambla was one of my favorite hotels during our month long trip throughout Spain. The hotel is modern, clean,tastefully decorated, in an ideal locarion (just one block north of the Gran Via)The room was a good size with a beautiful large private bathroom, airconditioning, flat screen TV, an easy to use in-room safe,a private balcony (which i suggest you request) a small fitness center, a restaurant serving breakfast only, and a small swimming pool (not heated) and sun deck on the roof. The rooms on the first floor have high ceiliings but are a bit noisier than the higher floors. In choosing a neighborhood in Barcelona i suggest staying away from the Ramblas which is noisy, crowded and a bit honky tonk for my taste. We booked the hotel on easytobook.com for a greatly reduced rate. The staff were very helpfu and a few doors away on the corner of the Gran Via iwas our favorite tapas bar,cafe and restaurant in Barcelona (Cuidad Condal) I enjoyed a coffee and pastry every morning at their outdoor cafe and ate different tapas every night.

Reviews.Title: “Fully recommended hotel - for location, price and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: GillianUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for 4 nights over Easter. Found hotel on internet and had read good reviews. Had excellent stay. Really welcoming, allowed us to use the room from 10am on arrival - I didn't expect to be allowed in until after lunchtime. Hotel was spotless. Beds and pillows comfy, lovely view onto street, bathroom well maintained and also spotless. Staff friendly and helpful. Didn't have breakfast but ate down the street. Great location - very close to Placa Catalunya and metro station. Lovely restaurants nearby - a must visit is Cuidad Contal on the corner. Fabulous tapas especially at lunchtime. Would definitely stay there again when I return to the lovely city. Also recommend a visit to the Born area down near the Picasso museum. Very bohemian, lots of funky bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: shameera
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just come back from Barcelona, and loved the hotel. The location - perfect. It was in a quiet street, which was just a few mins walk away from the Placa Catalunya & Las Ramblas. If u go further up then you would end up at the Barri Gothic & Port Vell. Then on the other side was the Passeig Gracia which is a more up scale shopping area. The staff were really friendly. Our view was looking out onto the street which was really pretty and the balcony was cute. The breakfast was fine, toast, fruit, cereal, pastries, yoghurt and coffee and tea. I can't really fault the hotel :-) T

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT :D”
Reviews.Author: PV_29
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel, it was clean, the staff were very very helpful, friendly and spoke fluent english which was extremely useful!!! the location was also perfect as it was in a quiet street so you can sleep at night but it was a few minutes walk away from metro stations, las ramblas, all the nicest bars, restuarants and cafes :D great value for money, i would definitely recommend this place to everyone who visits barcelona and i think it will be the only hotel i chose to stay in if i ever visit the city again!!! brilliant!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: nindita
Reviews.Content: My disabled daughter and I stayed 4 nights at the Onix (£399 in total) on Dec 26th. We arrived at 9pm, check-in was quick. All staff spoke fluent English. The room and whole hotel were immacutely clean, free internet (I bought my laptop and was given internet cable free from reception), mini bar, no tea/coffee facilities but I did bring a travel kettle and satchets of coffee and european 2-pin plug, TV, bathroom has a bidet, hair dryer, huge towels and the usual soaps etc. There are 2 lifts. Location was superb, walking distance to El Cortes Ingles - big department store with supermarket downstairs, La Rambla, metros, the Tour buses and a Carrefour Express in the La Rambla street. There is a taxi rank to your right from the Onix, I advise you to take the bus as the streets are so congested that you will be paying for just sitting in the traffic jam! There are lots of restaurants and cafes along the Onix street and delicious bakeries. The hotel staff were very helpful and free maps given freely.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nivster1
Reviews.Content: The Onix Rambla is a new hotel, it's location is as good as it gets in the very center of Barcelona, in a quiet street. It's a walking distance from Las Ramblas, metro stations, airport bus, tourist bus starting point and many more attractions. The hotel is new, rooms are clean, big and offer a nice street view from a small balcony. The rooftop pool wasn't operating during our stay (End of December) but it offered a nice view of the city. Staff was great also. Didn't eat in the hotel so no opinion on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Adding to the chorus of approval”
Reviews.Author: Graphiker
Reviews.Content: I'd like to thank all of you who recommended this hotel. It was just perfect for us. The location was great - within an easy walk of the major tourist places: Las Ramblas, Barri Gotic, Gaudi's Casa Batllo. Good restaurants abound nearly next door: La Tramoia, Cuidad Condal. Hotel is just round the corner from a taxi stand and a metro station, on a street with outdoor cafes. We requested a quiet room, and got one. I loved the simple, stylish decor (especially the lights in the hall floor). We always breakfasted at the Cuidad Condal, which had exactly what we wanted: cafe con leche and pan tostada at a reasonable cost (less than 5 E for both of us). The hotel staff was quick to respond to a small complaint (minor plumbing issue), and made it clear it would be solved to our satisfaction or we could change rooms. I think it had it all: style, location, helpful staff, comfort and what I consider affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, modern”
Reviews.Author: trvlcrzy
Reviews.Content: True to Barcelona form, the Onix Rambla was perfect for us in terms of location and amenities. It is your typical modern Barcelona hotel. Just request interior rooms if you want the quieter section of the hotel. We got a street view with balcony and as with any Spanish city on a weekend...the noise from the street went on until daybreak ( then suddenly quiet!). But, we expected that so it was OK for us. The only other quirk was the a/c not blowing cold enough air..but since it was in the 40-50's 'F at night, no problem. Bathrooms are always a plus in Spain..roomy with gleaming tilework and fixtures. Came with two slippers, saving kit, dental kit, shower caps on top of the usual soaps/shampoos..and a free sample of perfume from El Corte Ingles. Will stay there again as the price was also great and the room was spacious....plus, can't beat the location on Eixample..short walk most specially to the Cacao Sampaka around the corner and my favorite Mercat St. Joseph Boqueria.

Reviews.Title: “favorite hotel in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: favorite hotel in barcelona (been in 9 all same area) good 3 to 4 stars near plaza cataluña,ramblas and my favorite restaurant just in the corner (ciudad condal,be prepared for the line) small,inexpensive,no service(strange but i like that),good minimalist look ,open 2004 so pretty new. good breakfast selection with light /diet choices

Reviews.Title: “great to go with your girl!”
Reviews.Author: MrTona
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the center of the city, with a lot of nice bars and restaurants near by. the atmosphere was a little "cold", and it was a little expansive (i've paid 130E without breakfast, but it was a very hot week), but the room was really comfortable, and it had the BIGGEST BED i've ever seen: really great for s*x!! This hotel is very good for young people, and for everybody who travels to have fun, without pretending to kill the hotel staff for all their needs. N&J Florence-Italy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location: gaudi and the ramblas are there”
Reviews.Author: nanoparticle
Reviews.Content: We stayed one niight at the Onix and liked it very much. It is not perfect, though. The location is great, the room was OK (there is free internet access) but the breakfast is medium-poor level. The view from our room was poor: the terrace roof of the next building. The staff was friendly and the price we paid was worth what we have got. Recommended!
